page.title: 01COASTAL AREA
page.content: A SUMMARY OF THE COASTAL STRIP BETWEEN GREAT YARMOUTH AND CAISTER-ON-SEA This, almost entirely flat land, is a division between the town of Gt. Yarmouth, and the village of Caister-on-sea. the area includes the Southern third of Caister; the suburbs of Newtown, at the Northern end of GT. Yarmouth;and about 1.5 square Km. of land between the two. At present, the open-space in this area provides important land for leisure.Facilities include Bure Park,a Golfcourse,a Racecourse and a large Caravan Holiday Park. There are also two Heliports which serve North Sea Oil platforms. This is a coastal srip with an area of Coastal Marram Grass covered dunes, and a continuous stretch of beach with small tidal rise and fall, but strong current.
